Extreme Weather.name: Tidal Forces & Natural Phenomena
Extreme Weather.description: Explore the fascinating interplay of tides, natural disasters, and the world around us. This quiz tests your knowledge of everything from oil spills to plant life and animal behavior.

questions.text: Where did the Exxon Valdez run aground in March of 1989?
questions.hint: This Alaskan location is named after a British royal and known for its pristine waters.

questions.text: Which of these animals lays eggs?
questions.hint: This animal is an amphibian, unlike the others, which are mammals.

questions.text: Which of these plants is the national emblem of Scotland?
questions.hint: This prickly plant is a symbol of resilience in Scottish culture.

questions.text: What is produced during photosynthesis?
questions.hint: This gas is essential for animal life and released by plants as a byproduct.

questions.text: On average, what length of time passes between high tides?
questions.hint: This interval is influenced by the lunar cycle, occurring roughly twice a day.

questions.text: What force causes an ice cream cone to fly off of a spinning merry-go-round?
questions.hint: This force is related to the outward pull felt on spinning objects.

questions.text: On average, what length of time passes between high tides?
questions.hint: This interval is influenced by the lunar cycle, occurring roughly twice a day.

questions.text: What kind of animal is a peregrine?
questions.hint: This creature is known for its incredible speed, especially when diving.
